reqs: The first of a two-course series on western theatre history, THTR 320 provides a survey of the major theatre and performance traditions in Europe from the 5th century BCE until the 18th century CE. Students will examine performance traditions from ancient Greece and Rome, Medieval Europe, Elizabethan/Jacobean, and Restoration England. Some of the major issues covered in the course include: the relationship between performance and the cultural traditions in which they are situated; the effect of key developments in human communication, in particular oral, written, and print cultures, on theatre; and the role of historical evidence and theories in theatre history research.
description: Core concepts in world theatre history and the development of theatre prior to the nineteenth century.
